meanings.definition: A person who applies powder to something.
meanings.sent1: The makeup artist was one of the best powderers in the industry.
meanings.sent2: The powderers at the salon always make sure to match the foundation perfectly.
meanings.sent3: The powderers at the baby's birthday party accidentally turned the cake into a cloud of dust!
meanings.sent4: The powderers in the theater transformed the actors into different characters with their makeup.
meanings.sent5: The skilled powderers knew exactly how to enhance the features of their clients.

meanings.definition: A device used to grind or crush into powder.
meanings.sent1: The kitchen appliance was a powerful powderers that could turn spices into fine dust.
meanings.sent2: The old mill had a traditional stone powderers that was still in use.
meanings.sent3: The powderers in the laboratory went haywire and created a cloud of flour in the air!
meanings.sent4: The powderers in the factory worked tirelessly to ensure the ingredients were finely ground.
meanings.sent5: The electric powderers made quick work of turning the coffee beans into a fine powder.

meanings.definition: A substance composed of very fine particles.
meanings.sent1: The baby powderers left a trail of white footprints across the floor.
meanings.sent2: The volcanic ash cloud was a massive collection of powderers suspended in the air.
meanings.sent3: The powderers in the air created a magical shimmering effect in the sunlight.
meanings.sent4: The powderers of snow covered the landscape in a blanket of white.
meanings.sent5: The makeup artist used a shimmering powderers to highlight the cheekbones.
